before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"fuahj","text":"Take out PicoGreen (supplied in the PicoGreen kit) from fridge to thaw, before starting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":88}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9s4lr","text":"Protect it from light.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aa3mt","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bhffb","text":"PicoGreen is solid at 4°C and thaws at room temperature. The reagent is light sensitive and should be kept wrapped in foil both while thawing and in the diluted stage.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cpifj","text":"We use the Quant-iT™ PicoGreen® dsDNA kit for quantification of both extracted and amplified DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bjbnk","text":"The Quant-iT™ PicoGreen® dsDNA reagent is a proprietary, asymmetrical cyanine dye.  Free dye does not fluoresce, but upon binding to dsDNA it exhibits a \u003e1000-fold fluorescence enhancement.  PicoGreen is 10,000-fold more sensitive than UV absorbance methods, and highly selective for dsDNA over ssDNA and RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"28bg2","text":"For moreinformation see: https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/P7589","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":25,"length":56}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A42AD30DFFBB4475B36388718D06F057","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/P7589"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"e5mhq","text":"IMPORTANT:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"72m0u","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8310n","text":"When quantifying non-amplified DNA (for example DNA extracted from filters), work in the prePCR area of the lab using the kit designated for prePCR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"57qqb","text":"When measuring amplified DNA (for example PCR products), work in the postPCR usinf the kit located there. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"boced","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3f14n","text":"QUALITY ASSURANCE:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8jr9v","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"25k98","text":"Standards: always measure your samples with appropiate standards. The concentration of all of your sample has to fall within the standard range.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"aq2ue","text":"Replicates: always measure both for your samples and for the standards at least 2 technical replicates.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"25j1f","text":"Kit properties: Always write down the LOT number of the kit you use.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ai5gj","text":"Prepare TE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8agen","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7h7te","text":" Calculate the total volume of 1xTE needed: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7lak2","text":"200 µl per each technical replicate of your samples","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9hm5q","text":"100 µl per standard","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"addar","text":"Total of 3-400 µl for the DNA standard dilution (depending on the assay you use, see step 2)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4696k","text":"Make enough to count for pipetting losses!!!","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2fktb","text":"E. g. for high range: 20 samples + 2* 4 standards + DNA standard the amount is 20*200 + 8*100 + 300 = 5100 µl -\u003e make 5500 µl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1emkm","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fqc0k","text":" Dilute from 20xTE stock (supplied in the PicoGreen kit). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":57}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"38mgv","text":"Volume of 20xTE = final volume/20;","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"el8n5","text":"Volume of water = final volume – volume of 20*TE","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7tah8","text":"E.g. To make 5 ml: mix 250 µl of 20*TE with 4750 µl of water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9bqpo","text":"Prepare DNA standard","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6j75c","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2a1uj","text":" Dilute 100 µg/mL DNA standard (supplied in the PicoGreen kit) to working dilution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":1,"length":82},{"style":"bold","offset":18,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8ar05","text":"For high range prepare 2 ng/µl: mix 6 µl of DNA stock with 294 µl of 1*TE","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4johh","text":"For middle range prepare 0.5 ng/µl: mix 2 µl of DNA stock with 398 µl of 1*TE","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e15k4","text":"For high sensitivity prepare 0.05 ng/µl: mix 0.2 µl* of DNA stock with 399.8 µl of 1*TE ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":51,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"35t8o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b380a","text":"*As pipetting of 0.2 µl is not accurate with our pipettes, it is recommended to prepare first a 10-times dilution of the DNA standard and use 2 µl of that into 398 µl of 1*TE for the high sensitivity DNA standard dilution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jkt9","text":"Prepare PicoGreen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"at63p","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4nfr0","text":"Calculate the total volume of 1:200 diluted PicoGreen reagent needed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":69}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"85i6l","text":"For each standard and each unknown sample, a volume of 100 µL will be needed = total number of samples (standard + unknowns) x100 µl + some for pipetting losses.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dg412","text":"e.g. For standard series of 8 and 20 samples (=28 total) prepare 28*100 µl =2800 µl: -\u003e make 3000 µl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ftbo9","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2mpu9","text":"Dilute PicoGreen reagent with 1*TE. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"feho6","text":"Volume of PicoGreen = final volume/200;    ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dnf8i","text":"Volume of TE = final volume – volume of PicoGreen","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3g316","text":"e.g. Mix 15 µl of PicoGreen with  2985 µl of 1*TE","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fndep","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7k6pq","text":"KEEP diluted PicoGreen IN THE DARK UNTIL USE!!!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3hs3g","text":"Prepare plate - add standards","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9bea3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ba0f8","text":"Use NUNC 96-well flat bottom black plates. Cover with aluminium foil inside the lid.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cjtm3","text":"Mark samples needed to be measured on the lid and also diagram your plate layout in the table as follow (When possible, measure samples at least in duplicates).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4h6ia","text":"Plan the standard curve in the microtiter plate.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8sosr","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6st53","text":"Table 1 High range standard curve: for 2ul samples, test limit is 0 to 100 ng/ul - for higher concentration dilute your samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":66,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"185ne","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"8ls9c","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7t99","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"97o59","text":"Table 2 Low range standard curve: for 2ul samples, test limit is 0 to 25 ng/ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"23rm1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"cbf2m","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8n6me","text":"Table 3 Low range standard curve: for 2ul samples, test limit is 0 to 2.5 ng/ul","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6cobg","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"2qhgr","text":"Prepare plate - add TE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"255oe","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fvieh","text":"Add 1*TE to each standard well according to table 1-3.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7av34","text":"Add 98 µl of 1*TE to each sample well. Prepare 2 wells for each sample (duplicates).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6inq7","text":"Prepare plate - add DNA samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c43bb","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9v8mc","text":"Add 2-5 µl of sample to each sample well. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"172do","text":"Prepare plate - add DNA standard","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"922ss","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"f2ujv","text":"Add diluted DNA standard according to Table 1-3. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"en798","text":"Prepare plate - add PicoGreen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"di150","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dd3sd","text":"Add 100 µl of diluted PicoGreen to each of the wells (both sample and standard wells) and mix by pipetting 5-10 times.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6slq","text":"Incubate in room temperature in dark for at least 5 minutes and measure with the plate reader (ask for help using the plate reader if using it for the first time).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7fovv","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":"300","guid":"23FEA1DFBBB541A18EDFDB38381F6BF4","id":"11551","label":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"agsf1","text":"To calculate your DNA concentration:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b5tqa","text":"Create a calibration curve in excel or similar from the standards (x axis: measured fluorescens, y axis: total DNA in standard wells in ng from corresponding tables in step 4).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3redq","text":"Use the equation of the fitted trendline (excel) to calculate the amount of DNA (ng) in your samples.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2b71l","text":"To calculate the DNA concentration of your samples (ng/μl), divide the calculated amount of DNA (ng) by the volume of DNA (μl) that you added in step 6 (2-5 μl).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

title: DNA quantification with PicoGreen
